Reviews.Title: “Improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi72222
Reviews.Content: Having helpful staff at reception would be a good start to improving this hotel. The location is good and they have the potential to be an ideal place to stay for business travellers. The breakfast should be scrapped as not once did we eat the pathetic offering of food in this tiny hot room. I knew to expect a small room as this seems to be the HK norm however I did not expect the room to smell of dampness and have water stains on the walls. I suspect it is a leaking building as the dampness was evident in a few places. Other negative reviews dating back several months are reponded to with messages of thanks and promises of improvements, but I could see no evidence of any. Come on Management...you might be missing out on future business by not addressing the same issues that keep being bought to your attention! I know that I will be staying elsewhere from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, well located and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGAB
Reviews.Content: This is one funky and modern hotel with an excellent location with walking distance to the subway. The room was simply modern with lots of glass and lots of white with modern furniture. The usual excellent features expected from a modern hotel such as free WiFi, iPod dock, Flat screen TV etc. The breakfast room is the smallest I have seen with a very small choice of pastry and kids style packed cereals. So if you are big in to your breakie, I would forget about eating at the hotel and check out the big choice within the vicinity of the hotel. The price for your room is reasonable, so you can afford to spend the savings on a nice breakfast outside. Overall, this is one very well priced, pleasing and very confortable hotel for a place like Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “strange place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Alex A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely situated, rooms are clean, light, calm though the size is really greedy... But the stuff... sorry, i've never had such experience: if you expect any kind of reaction of the receptionists, forget about that!! They really don't care about the guests. No idea about the reason to behave like this. But it looked very sad... To their shame, they have to stop to offer B&B cause nobody can call a set of fake coffee, buns and jam as a real breakfast! Was enough to visit this strange, dirty and small breakfast room just first morning, very dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Great - service average”
Reviews.Author: Shirley H
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that both my husband and I have been to the iClub Hotel in Wan Chai. The rooms are spacious and modern and the bed and bedding comfortable. The reception service is definitly average, and the assistance of the local staff regarding recommendations for restuarants etc could certainly be better. (We got food poisoning on our second night here). We have also stayed twice at the Regal Kowloon and again the reception/concierge service leaves a lot of room for improvement. Before generalising on the group, we will try one more hotel in Hong Kong under the Regal group, and if the experience is similar, then it is time for the Senior Management to make a few serious adaptions to remain in line with other international brand hotels in Hong Kong. Pricing is average - mid-range.

Reviews.Title: “An 'ok' accomodation”
Reviews.Author: babykhoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Regal iClub from 18th to 22nd July 2012 with my husband. He was there on a business trip while I was there for the Summer Sale. Location of the hotel was good with the nearest MTR (Wan Chai station) about 5-8 minutes walk away, also there were many good "tea restaurants" located in the vicinity of the hotel. So food was definitely not a problem for us. However if you are looking for upmarket restaurants or fine dining then this location isn't for you. More traditional local eateries available here, which taste great and very cheap too. Our room came with daily breakfast but we never ventured to the breakfast area in the hotel as we rather eat out. Also with the Wan Chai station located nearby it made shopping a breeze for me, since I was moving around alone most of the time. I took the MTR everywhere, didn't need the taxi service at all except for getting to the hotel from the airport (as I arrived after midnight). Easy access to the Central, Causeway Bay areas as well as Mongkok on Kowloon island. We stayed in an iSelect room. It was very small, with little space to walk after our 2 luggages are opened on the floor. Despite the miniature size of the room, the room was kept clean all the time with free bottles of mineral water replenished daily. There was also a fridge and a microwave in the room. Fridge comes empty but it's no problem as there are a few 24 hour convenience stores around that area, so you can fill it up with whatever you wish. One thing to note is that there is minimal privacy in the bathroom area as they use frosted glass for the toilet walls and door. So if you wish to stay in the room with someone other than your spouse I recommend someone whom you are very very close.... I can't comment much on the hotel's service as we did not engage much of their services. I would highly recommend this hotel to travellers who are going to be on the move most of the time rather than relax in the hotel. The room isn't exact a picture of warmth and tranquility, but it does serve it's purpose as a rest stop after all the walking, eating and shopping in Hong Kong. The rate of the room is not too bad. We managed to book it through booking.com at quite a good rate of about SGD$160 per night. Would I stay here again? Maybe,,,

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: Snllim
Reviews.Content: It's terrible. Poor service. No room at check in time.Keep me waiting. No eye contact. No greeted. Limited English keep playing phone. Ignore customer. Said rude Cantonese word. Why staff so rude and angry. Towels are dirty. No adaptor no comb. Didnt refill daily water. Room smelly. New but dirty. It's not cheap anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Central, excellent fit-out, good price (if you use something like Ctrip)”
Reviews.Author: LeighSydneyChina195
Reviews.Content: Apparently this was called the Butterfly Hotel (according to my taxi driver) and has been refurbished as the Regal iClub. The rooms are fitted extremely well. Everything is new and working well. The buffet breakfast is also excellent if you can find it.. and when you get there.. if you can find a seat... it is a very small eating area. Get in early. Located in Wan Chai, it is central to most things and the MTR station is just down Johnston Street. Will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not recommend”
Reviews.Author: andrea f
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband for six nights. I read the comments on Tripadvisor and everybody said the Hotel was good, but it was not what he found. The room is very small, the receptionist was more concerned with making him pay for another larger room and not to give him the Keys`s room. He waited for two hours to enter the room after flying 12 hours. the breakfast room only fit 10 people, it unacceptable for this kind of Hotel. We already stayed in others Regal`s Hotels and the others are not so bad like this. We never stay again and not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Regal but very enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: koalaking
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regal for 2 nights earlier this week and thought I would give them a shout out. Simply, this is a clean, modern and convenient hotel which is priced well in it's market. The staff were friendly and the rooms clean. When I am in Hong Kong next I will happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but has security issues”
Reviews.Author: Patty1221_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good bang for the buck and walking distance from wan chai station. Rooms are small but clean. We got a free upgrade to a suite with a living room. However, our friend who had a single room had a problem with the shower door. Repairmen came in to fix it. When she came back to they room, her camera was gone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Adelasimek
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel from lastminute.com. Very good price for such a great place. Room is clean, modern, spacious. Staff is polite and location- very closed to everything. Tram stop and supermarket just opposite entrance. Tube 2 mins walk. Easy to find. No opportunity found.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel..”
Reviews.Author: KevanEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on business...booked through CTRIP. This hotel is easy to find being not far from Wan Chai MTR. Located near the business area and within the world renowned entertainment area of HKG. The room was big compare to other HKG hotels and very clean/modern. Breakfast was OK: Staff very helpful: not the cheapest....but overall for a two night stay it served it's purpose of being clean, safe and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and bed”
Reviews.Author: safircraze
Reviews.Content: I booked one night the iBusiness room. The room is of good size for hk standard, and the bed is firm perfect. Free wifi is fab Location is perfect with lotsa eateries and mtr station only 3 mins walk while tram is just front of d hotel. The hotel also provide free transfer to aiport which is handy as i dont wanna drag many suitcases full from shopping trips Now i dont like wall mounted tv. I cant watch tv in that position. Breakfast is quite sad, as there is no hot meal Location near masjid wanchai about 5-10 mins walk. As d mosque also has canteen, my mom is happy with the chinese fare dinner and dimsum brunch at the masjid Will i stay here again?? Hmm if i am with my mom or if i dont need bfast or on business that means i wont have time for long bfast, i would. If i am on leisure that i can enjoy long bfast with hot meals, i would look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY, WORST HOTEL EVER...”
Reviews.Author: myn2012
Reviews.Content: Let us start by staying, my husband and I travel a lot throughout the year, and for the price that we paid, we've had much better experience with other hotels and resorts. We expected more from Regal Iclub, and this is the worst hotel experience we ever had. We stayed at the hotel from April 14-19, 2012, we paid more than $250 Canadian a night for the king bed ibusiness guest room. The purpose of our stay was that we were on our Honeymoon. Due to such a horrible experience during our stay, it left us very disappointed and ruined our honeymoon. I have personally emailed "Regal iClub" and informed the hotel that the purpose of our stay was for our honeymoon and I got a reply back stated that the message will be forwarded and attached to the reservation. However, upon arrival, we were not greeted or acknowledged as being on our honeymoon, no congratulations, no welcome to the hotel, nothing at all. All of the other hotels we have been to; the staff congratulated us and presented us with a free bottle of house wine, champagne, cakes, home made cookies and even a free upgrade to club suite. Needless to say, Regal iClub left us disappointed in this regard, and we will be sure not to recommend any of our friends and family to go there in the future. All of the hotels went above and beyond and made us feel special for our stay with them during our honeymoon, except Regal iClub. However, there was nothing special that they did for us. Absolutely nothing. On the very 1st day we checked in, we found a room with lots of hair on the bed sheets. That is very dirty, horrible and told me what a sloppy job Regal iClub has done cleaning the rooms. I wanted to complaint to the front desk right away, however my husband was really tired from the 16 hours flight from Canada, so we clean the hair off ourselves and went to sleep. On the 2nd day, after we returned to the hotel at night, the light bulb in the washroom was burned out, the plastic seal on the shower door was broken and we noticed a very bad sewage smell from the washroom. We asked the front desk to have it fix and the response we got was: "ok, we will have someone fix it by tomorrow". On the following day, before we left the hotel we once again reminded the front staff to have all of the things above to be fixed by the time we get back to the hotel. Not to our surprise, when we got back, all the things were still not fixed, and we called the front desk and informed them again. All they did was sending housekeeping in and we were told that technician will be in tomorrow, and they will have it fixed. At the same time, front desk asked the housekeeping lady to give us a bottle of air freshener to spray the washroom in order to cover the unfixed sewage smell that was coming from there. The Housekeeping lady came in and told us the following in these exact words: "I am very busy now, I have many rooms to clean, and is very late now, I am HUNGRY, and have not eaten dinner yet so I will come back later and give you the spray bottle." If you were in our position, how would you feel? We are on our honeymoon, everything broke down and went wrong in this hotel, and now horrible service!!?? Is this how you treat your guests!!?? The feeling we got from this was; we paid for this expensive hotel, everything is broken in the hotel room, and no one is trying to fix anything at all. No one welcomed us, and the worst was that the housekeeping lady is saying we are bothering her and preventing her from eating her dinner??? This is just ridiculous, beyond words and there is no words that can descried how angry, upset and disappointed we were. We understand that she probably was hungry and tired, but this is not the guest fault right? Also, you do not tell your guest that you are Hungry and Tired. You can eat during your breaks, or before work. I have worked in customer service industry in many different roles, and this is not the way to treat your guests. The most unbelievable part was after the housekeeping lady gave us the air freshener, she informed us that if other guest needs it, she will have to come back and grab it from us because she only has 1 can of air freshener for the whole hotel. At that point we were completely in shock. For such a big hotel, Regal iClub only has 1 bottle of air freshener!!?? This is ridiculous and not the proper way to run a business never mind a hotel. Finally the following day we got back everything was fixed, except the horrible sewage smell still coming from the bathroom. Once again like clockwork we received another horrible experience; a note from the hotel stating there will be no water supply from 11:00pm April 18 - 6:00am April 19. This was very inconvenient not just to us but all of your guests. As we are on vacation we usually stay out late and come back around 11 pm or afterwards and because of this inconvenience from this hotel (no backup plan for this or consideration/compensation) we had to travel all the way to the other side of the city to our relatives place to take a shower. The thing is it doesn't matter if this is required by the government or not. The hotel is suppost to guarantee a good stay for the guest and not to inconvenience them as well as running water. And if something comes up there should be a backup plan and if not compensation! There should be compensation for making a guests stay so inconvenient as well as an apology. On April 19th, the day we left, to add insult to injury our horrible experience from Regal iClub; we woke up and noticed there were little blood stains everywhere on the bed sheet. We were petrified and at a lost of words. We had slept in dirty, and BLOOD stained sheets for the whole night!!!! It just sent shivers up our spine that Regal iClub does not clean and maintain their facilities properly. The fact that we slept in blood stained sheets all night is even more ridiculous. How can a hotel this big, give their guests dirty bedsheets to sleep in? In addition to having no water supply until 6:00 am, we wanted to take a shower after having seen the dirty bed sheets, we realized quickly that there was no HOT water in the shower. Once again, we informed front desk, and escalated to the supervisor on-site. It took him half an hour to have a technician to check and find out why. The result was that for some reason, something was broken and they only had hot water up to the 15th floor, and everything above was cold water. Well isn't that great, another issue with your facilities not being run and managed properly and tested after maintenance. The supervisor offered to find us a room, so we can use the washroom and take a shower. Then it took him an hour to get us a room on the 5th floor so that we could do what we were meant to do hours ago. Once again inconvenience to your guests with no compensation or consideration to the fact. When we did check out, we advised the supervisor all the complaints that we had during our horrible stay at Regal iClub. All he did was apologize, and did not attempt to do anything else to save our impression of this dreadful hotel. We then asked for the General Managers email adress, but all we got from him was the general email information inquiry email address on a tiny little piece of paper. Not even a card! Can you imagine that!? What a petty and horrible way to do business and handle customer service issues. Is there no process to file complaints? I'm sure Expedia, trip advisor and many travel forums on the Internet would love to hear my story. Ultimately we have to go online on our own and search for your email address. Our experience with your hotel is so bad that it disappointed us every single day until that day we leave and WE will always REMEMBER to stay away from Regal hotels. We would never recommend any friends or family to stay at such a horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: frou83
Reviews.Content: one of my best hotel experiences and i travel a lot. bed was comfortable, breakfast was more than i had expected, given the fact that it was complimentary. free wifi was a huge bonus. gym is small but does its job. love the fact that the hotel staff allowed us to use the gym's shower room even after we had checked out. this just shows that their service is limitless. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Jenny S
Reviews.Content: Service limited. Staff unfriendly, spoke limited English. Reception's back area was messy and disorganized. Guests' luggage scattered everywhere in the tiny lobby. No bell service, good luck with your heavy stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Spare a little smile of welcome for me please!”
Reviews.Author: CHUA S
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern, trendy and conveniently located. Free wi-fi in the room is most appreciated. Service is efficient but unfriendly. Front-line staff seem to reserve their greetings and smiles for a certain segment of guests. Example: Guest X and I were in the lift when a staff member walked in, Staff greeted guest X but completely ignored me. This scenario happened twice during my 2-night stay, indicating that it is unlikely to be a coincidence. This type of service mindset sadly reminds me of colonial Hong Kong pre- 1997. For me the choice is clear; hotels with courteous and friendly staff always get my vote and repeat patronage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very hard beds”
Reviews.Author: JJ54321
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conviently located opposite a tram stop, a few minutes walk from the MTR. Breakfast best avoided, plenty of eateries all around the area so no problem with that. We booked the Iresidence, because of the 2 room configuration, perfect for a family if you want a little more space than interconnecting rooms. The internal doors very heavy and will not stay open, so mind the fingers of your little ones. The showers were good and powerful, there is even a sign on the door saying please keep your bathroom door closed and air conditioning on, otherwise showering will set off the fire alarm. The beds were the hardest we have encountered in a hotel, akin to sleeping on a wooden board. Housekeeping a bit poor - we found 3 slippers around the bed, left over from the last occupant(s). We stayed 5 nights, but the sheets were only change once (after the first night as there were holes on the duvet covers). Fresh towels placed in our room had stains. Staff at front desk very efficient, had some problem with wifi which was sorted out on the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: KJBKKKHK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for business and travel. Its reasonable and all you need. It is not a spa resort. Just a clean, nice room, with internet. Nothing else you need. The milk place beside it is better than the breakfast! Take the trollys to the main shopping area and walk down a few streets to the markets. We loved it and we stay in 5 star hotels all the time:)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for it's price.”
Reviews.Author: Yharary
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the money. Stuff is very helpful and nice. Room is big, clean and modern. Location is excellent close to mtr station. I stayed there 5 nights and would come again if they will not raise the price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wordsmith82
Reviews.Content: Obviously, this isn't a luxury hotel, but for its type it is fantastic. The decor is modern and pristine. I had a standard room that I was very happy with. These are not huge hotel rooms, but they are spacious. It was spotless and the bed was extremely comfortable. Big TV, rainfall shower, lots of storage space. The staff were friendly and helpful. I really can't find any fault with this small, very smart hotel. A complimentary breakfast capped off a very relaxing one night stay before my flight back to UK. I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: karoh h
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Hong Kong and specifically looked for hotel in the central area around Wan Chai. The hotel is within walking distance of the Wan Chai MTR, and the double decker trams pass at the front of the hotel. We stayed in an iBusiness room, because we were worried that the other rooms could be a bit too small. The room was very functional and modern, and we had access to the free Wifi in our room, although the quality of the network was sometimes a bit patchy. We used the breakfast option that was included in the rate: it is basic (croissants, orange juice, coffee or tea, and some cereals), but does the job. Staff were efficient and friendly, and late check-in is not a problem (we arrived around 1 a.m.) I would not hesitate to go back to this hotel when in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything but the bed!”
Reviews.Author: poshw5
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their website and on arrival we got upgraded to a suite which was great and meant lots more space. There were a few teething problems with the way it worked as the bedroom door had a separate lock to the lounge and you needed the key card in a slot to make the electricity work and if you left the bedroom door open the alarm went off... but they sorted it all out very quickly! Great staff on reception! Can I just say that the shower was the BEST hotel shower I have had in a very long time.. full rain shower. The room came with an ipod radio docking station which was great. It was really modern and everything felt new. The view from 23rd floor was good. The location of the hotel was really good too as only a 10 min walk from the amazing Times Square.. well amazing if you LOVE shopping anyway! Breakfast was good for free.. it is a continental breakfast with pastries, cereal, fruit and tea/coffee/orange juice.. perfect to get your day off to a good start! My only negative about the Regal iClub and the reason why I possibly wouldn't go back (which is a shame as all other things were great) is the bed was REALLY hard.. both of us found it really uncomfortable. If I hear about them getting new softer beds I will definitely be back! TOP TIP:- if you are staying at Regal iClub - to get free transport to/from the airport.. get the airport express and then jump on the free shuttle bus that goes to Novotel Century and walk from there (the driver will show you the way!)...

Reviews.Title: “White on white done right..!”
Reviews.Author: Andy1pilot
Reviews.Content: A good central location on Hong Kong Island between Wan Chai and Causeway Bay... Stayed in an "iBusines room... The decor is a modern white on white... Large comfy king bed and a lot of glass in the room... Fridge and microwave in room... We got breakfast included with our stay at no extra charge (many nights at Regal hotels)... Small little restaurant on 1st floor nothing gourmet but does the job perfectly... Would stay here anytime..!

Reviews.Title: “Much better off staying elsewhere. Unless this is the absolute last place.”
Reviews.Author: happybutnotsosolucky
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were astonished to see be the check-in area. It was in a mess. No greetings from the staff. Perhaps because they were busy earlier. REALLY regretted booking this 'hotel'. We felt so deceived after we saw our room. Cant tell from the photos clearly. Our friend(who never stayed here before) recommended this place because we had to go to the exhibition and convention area and I must say this place is really near. The only saving grace of that place. We booked a room with a double bed for couple but they were pretty persistent in persuading us to take a room that has two separate beds and that is supposedly bigger,we refused and they were slightly annoyed and told us, then we have to take a much smaller room since we insist on a double bed, We agreed. After checking in, we went to our room. LO AND BEHOLD, its so weird! After you enter, there is a long and narrow walkway and a sharp right to the room and it faces an old building's toilet. The old building is so close, you feel claustrophobic almost immediately(but its HKG afterall). The toilet is a weird glass structure which bath curtains are used as shields. It goes around the toilet, to provide privacy. The toilet smelled like a wet ashtray. The super king sized bed almost fills up that corner. The end of the bed is the wall. It weird why they decided to mount the tv right on top of the wall, which makes it almost impossible to watch unless you wanna risk neck problems. We requested for a change of room and was told that the room will be even smaller. Then I asked if we would change to the original room that was offered(the two bedded room one which she mentioned was bigger), her reply was," it's exactly the same size(layout), just with two beds". Well..... The new matchbox sized room was fine. except that the bed was right beside the door. if they open the door by mistake, they can actually see u. :) The downside is, the floors are not carperted and its really noisy. whoever your neighbor is, really makes a difference, The noise we had to endure was bad. The guest staying in the room adjacent to ours was always opening and closing his bag, accidentally banging the wall. Opening and closing of the doors on the same floor or directly on top , can be heard very very loudly. Walls are thin(no good for light sleepers). Imagine the guest from different rooms(about 6 rooms each floor), cleaners opening and closing many times throughout the day. The doors do not come with anti slam nor fur to cushion the impact. It is really loud eventhough the guests have absolutely no intention to slam. I think the management should really look into retrofitting the doors with something to soften the impact of closing the doors. Afterall, guests stay in hotels, to rest. Amenities given are really basic. Toothbrushes, shampoo, showergel, lotion and shower cap are provided. Overall, this hotel is only worth is if you dun need to sleep well and if proximity is your only expectation. Service you get definitely doesnt match the price tag. You are really paying for the location. Surprised to read the other review which mentioned that the service is good and its "surprisingly spacious". I really dun get where he get that from.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: mrmnem
Reviews.Content: I stayed there just one night before flying back home. First of all, the area (Wan Chai) is great; there's plenty to do and see day and night. The hotel is very clean, staff have been polite with me, and my room was great, surprisingly spacious for HK, and clean, on a higher floor. The only complaint I could have is about breakfast: the breakfast room is far too small for the hotel and only few people could actually seat and eat. Many more were standing, waiting for other people to leave in order to take a table. By the time I got there - about 9 am - there was almost nothing left. So I just grabbed a coffee and went to have breakfast out. Other than that, it's a pretty good hotel, maybe a bit expensive compared to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very little else!”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location to see Hong Kong as long as you not want to spend much time in your room. The room was very basic and a very strange layout, especially the glass bathroom with a curtain around. The business lounge with free Internet and coffee is a great benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: zjsgpt
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here and once again I was extremely pleased with the location, value and service which was courteous, friendly and efficient. I was upgraded to a suite which was extremely spacious, clean and functional. This is by no means a luxury hotel, but it is clean and the service attitude is better than I have received at many 5-star hotels. In particular, the front desk (Samantha, Enos) were very friendly and helpful and when I called to ask for an iron and ironing board, it arrived in less than 3 minutes. They were also very accomodating when I requested a late checkout. Location is great if you need to run around town and make frequent trips to and from the hotel with trams and taxis easy to get outside the hotel on Johnston Road. Lots of nearby food options too for quick eats. Only complaint is that the wifi signal was not strong enough to use my laptop in the bedroom but hopefully they will be able to fix this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms, no service”
Reviews.Author: stuash82
Reviews.Content: This is a functional hotel in the Wan Chai area of HK. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, MTR, ferries, and almost anything you'd want to do. The rooms are alright - the bathrooms are not very practical as they have glass doors and don't really shut. We stayed in a suite, and the bathroom was in the main living area - very unusable if there are other people in the room. The service was ordinary - like I said before, its meant to be a functional hotel, not luxurious. They have a restaurant in the hotel with decent food, but there are so many places around the corner, you wouldn't need to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: charic77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as a one night stopover in Hong Kong. Location is good. Hotel is in walking distance from many transportation options. Rooms are small and basic. Free internet on my stay. Breakfast is rolls, coffee, fruit, instant noodles in a small lounge room - not much to speak of. Property is clean. My view from the 6th floor was only buildings and a McDonalds up the street but I easily found numerous options for dining after 9 pm. If you are looking for a bed in a clean room with a good shower in a good location, this works.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place with a perfect location in Wan Chai!”
Reviews.Author: mapglobal2
Reviews.Content: I made a ‘foodie’ stop in HK for a couple days on the way to the Philippines, and stayed at the Regal iClub . It’s location in Wan Chai is perfect. Within 3-4 min walk to the metro and you can very easily walk to C-bay or Central, or catch a tram (right in front of the hotel), or a bus on Hennessay (or on Wan Chai Rd). Our room, on the 19th floor had quite a nice view and was very nice, spacious and really spotless. The only not so good thing about the room was the floor. The floor covering is kind of a slick covering and the desk chair really slides on it. On two occasions I ended up on the floor as the chair just shots out and ‘bam’ you’re on the floor. So, just be careful. What I like is that there are only four (4!) rooms per floor, so it’s nice and quiet, at least from the guest, although the maids in the morning are quite loud, so you’ll likely not be able to sleep very late. Internet is included and I can report that it is fast and strong with no annoying drop-outs. They do serve a ‘breakfast’ which is only pastries, but it’s filling and surprisingly, they just leave it out all day until it’s gone. On more than one occasion I went down and grabbed a croissant pretty late in the day. The breakfast lounge is also spotless, I might add. So, if you’re looking for a nice small place tucked into the perfect location, Regal ICLub in Wan Chai is not a bad pick at all! I'm in and out of HK all the time, so any question, just give me a shout. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big rooms with kitchenette (with microwave)”
Reviews.Author: winktink
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night with Rgal iClub. Chose it for its location, which is fantastic! Less than 5 mins walk to MTR with lots of cha can ting & dim sum to eat just across the hotel. It is also next to this Hokkaiddo eatery which seemed to be a hit with the locals. The frontage of the hotel is nothing to shout about. But I was impressed with the room when I got to it. They upgraded me to the rooms with kitchenette (on 10th floor) and it was spacious with 2 nice double bed. The rooms is newly renovated. Flooring is laminate wood but it didn't bother me too much. Breakfast was included but I did not check it out. There are just too many other yummy food in HK :p I would stay in the hotel again if I go back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better options in Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: sumeet r
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night four day trip to Hong Kong, was put up at the Regal I club (part of the regal group of hotels) located in Wanchai, the room was booked at approximately USD180 per night, with breakfast as part of a business conference group. Firstly, most Hotels are expensive in HK and rooms are tiny so to speak. The Hotel can be missed if you are hailing a taxi from the Airport express station in Central, or taking a direct taxi from the Airport, so lookout for the post code and building number on Johnston Road, my taxi guy drove around twice to locate the place. There are no valets or concierge for the luggage, this is more like a poorer version of the courtyard-marriots. Check-in was smooth and prior to the mandatory 12 pm check in, was allotted the room on the 5th floor (with no view, just some buildings accross), with queen bed (all non-smoking rooms here), they have a all day access lounge for tea and coffee on the same floor, with guests coming and going from morning onwards for the breakfast and the opening and closing of the lounge door is fairly disturbing, as my room was right accross. So need for that early morning alarm, as this was alarmingly loud. The room by itself, was well appointed and extremely clean, with good airconditioning and open bath, with a plasma and even an ipod -dock for music. The breakfast, was actually a cold breakfast, with milk and cereal, some croissants and juice a decent coffe-maker, skipped it after the first day, hopped accross for some Mc donalds right opposite the street, a better bet for a early morning start. While i have been visiting HK, for over 10 years now and almost regularly, i have stayed at some better hotels at a lesser room rate with fabulous facilities and location, like the Cosmopolitian in Happy valley, the Rennaissance and the Harbour Plaza Metropolis or North Point. The hotel, is close to Wanchai station and a short distance to the Times Square mall in causeway bay. Overall the hotels lacks character and the warmth, its more like a bed and breakfast in my opinion. Much better options out there, in HK. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rayandchri
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a relatively good location. Rooms are very small but clean with good showers. Service is minimal with crap breakfast included. Price is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snakpaks
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) good location - close to Wan Chai station 2) rooms were small but storage available to tuck luggage aside 3) clean, bright room 4) bottled water provided free of charge 5) good basic breakfast but ran of fast 6) quiet for sleep time 7) strong wifi connection available in rooms Cons: 1) average front desk service 2) a little on the pricey side 3) money exchange not available

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the centre of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: BoroughMark
Reviews.Content: Cheerful and helpful check-in staff, great rooms and fantastic location. This is a great hotel in the centre of Hong Kong which I cannot recommend more highly

Reviews.Title: “Clean and efficient boutique business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TP2WXC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and spacious. I had free wifi with my rate and the speed was acceptable. I love the iPod compatible alarm clock. Good location about 5 minutes walk from Wanchai station. 20 minutes walk to the convention center. Lots of places to eat. Several negative issues: 1. Aside from one receptionist that was friendly and professional, the others were quite cold. 2. Check in process took longer than other hotels I've stayed. Seemed like they need to make severals calls to process my information. 3. Do not lean too far forward on the desk chair. The chair fipped when i was trying to reach for something and the fall was not pleasant in the hard floor. They should put mats below these chairs to prevent accidents. 4. No ice anywhere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The cheapest of the best”
Reviews.Author: crazi4oreos
Reviews.Content: This hotel was probably one of the cheapest hotels out of the good hotels in hong kong that we found. Check in was an ease as there were english speakers. The room was a bit small but was very clean and felt spacey because of the mirror. In the room the bathroom is see through but there is a curtain to close it off. Breakfast wasn't fantastic as there weren't that many choices but it was okay. There were pastries, croissants, and cereal. The location to MTR was fantastic, i think only a 2 minute walk, but finding the hotel at first was a bit hard, but after that it was an ease. Make sure that you are heading to regal iclub and not regal club. the view from our room was just the hong kong street, nostalgic looking but also old looking. we didnt see the harbor. However for some reason i feel like we could get a better hotel for the price we paid but i don't regret staying at this hotel. FYI: this hotel has no pool, beds are single but queen size, and they only have hk plugs but they do give you converters. Also while sleeping you can hear a bit of the outside traffic

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean modern rooms and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: VeeTee_11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was awesome from start to finish. When we arrived at HK International Airport, we looked around for transport options to get us to the hotel and found that there was an airport shuttle bus. This was a great option - cheap (105 HKD each) and convinient - we only had to wait 20mins for it. The journey took about 1.5hours, but it was a good tour of HK. When we checked into the hotel, we were lucky enough to get an upgrade to the iBusiness room. Our room was spotless, so clean, modern and spacious! The bathroom had glass walls, which my friend and I were originally a bit worried about - but it was fine because there was a curtain which completely covered the bathroom. The shower was awesome, with both a hand held and overhead rain shower head. The twin beds were big and comfy with soft pillows. The location of this hotel is excellent. There are heaps of great places to eat nearby, Wan Chai station is only a 3min walk and it connects to other popular train lines. We also walked to Times Square (took about 10-15mins) and to the Victoria Harbour/Convention Centre area (also took approx 10-15mins). I would suggest buying an Octopus card if you are planning on using trains or trams (or 7-11s) because they are really convenient, saves you having to look for change all the time and you can get a refund of whatever money you have left on your card before you leave HK. The reception staff that we encountered were great and always willing to help. In particular, Samantha was always there to listen to our questions and give us advice about where to eat and the easiest way to get places. Level 5 also has computers with the internet to use for free (although the touchscreen monitors are really annoying!). Breakfast was included in our room price, but it is more of a morning tea - apples, oranges, croissants, tarts, coffee, juice and cereal. But it does the job! Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel due to the convenient location, airport shuttle bus and incredibly clean rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great location... poor front desk...”
Reviews.Author: tonydv8
Reviews.Content: Love the location, quaint white boutique room, goos plasma TV with good channel choice, (no HBO) BUT poor basic breakfast (I ate in restaurant next to lobby-great not connected to hotel) and poor front desk staff attitude. They made me wait from midday till 2pm (Check In Time). But checked in several demanding Asians mean while!! (Im from London). Front Desk Staff were grumpy with me, served several people standing behind me, again Asians whilst I sat there..She even checked a person out whilst I sat there with bill discussions everything (all in Cantonese of course). I felt unwelcome as a Westerner there. To speak English seems a big effort for them! Noisy corridors, slamming doors...paper thin walls..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: ZohaibAkhtar
Reviews.Content: We went for the fair in HK Convention Center, It was a brilliant location for us. Just 5 minutes walk to the Exhibition Center. Its also a 10 minute walk to Times Square Shopping Center. Bigger rooms as compared to other Hotels in HK. Small Kitchen, and in room free Broadband internet was an added point. The room was advertised as "Breakfast Included" however its not breakfast. They just had Coffee / Juice and croissants. But overall it was a wonderful stay, and would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair - but not great”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: Room 1704 It is not the smallest room on the floor - strage shape, a corridor that goes around another room. So all in all, its not big - and other rooms are smaller! (I guess this is what "boutique" is all about) 2 x beds - that were not very comfortable, I found it too hard. The TV (OK) is mounted high - you have to lie on the bed, looking up, to see it. Tea and coffee facility, but please add "English breakfast tea" to the selection! Lots and lots of blinds - I had to lower and raise 5 blinds every day to keep the light out. Fairly quiet room - I heard a few car horns from the street. Foyer and lift carpet needed a good clean when I was there. Chairs in the lounge/breakfast room are badly stained. Finding the hotel - I can see why some struggle, there is no signage at street level, just 211 Johnston Road but no clear hotel sign. Sitting in the restaurant opposite the street - I can see an I-Club sign, but its high up and not easy to see at street level. Breakfast level 5 - small room, simple breakfast, not much fun in there. Not much in the way of service - you just check in and out, and help yourself at the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlatore
Reviews.Content: I generally don't make a point to rate hotels, but I have to say that this was certainly a pleasant stay. The location was close enough to the train and you were able to walk around by foot and enjoy much of the Hong Kong city. There are many food places around and the hotel breakfast which is next door was absolutely fabulous and plentiful. Rooms were fairly small but very convenient, modern and comfortable. I had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and new rooms in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: alphalau
Reviews.Content: Basic lobby, no services, but that is what I expected from this boutique hotel in any case so that is not an issue. The rooms are compact but reasoably-sized for a boutique hotel in the city centre. Rooms are white with modern decor and very clean, large TV, good bathroom. The only negative is that the doors/walls are perhaps thin and I could hear the conversations of the people outside in the corridoor and no doubt they could also hear whats going on in our room. A bit pricey though for a basic boutique hotel (albeit nice rooms). HKD1,400 + tax (about USD180 + tax). I could get a much larger and nicer room at East Hotel, for example, at this price. But the location is good. Middle of Wanchai, tram stop just opposite the road, easy to get taxis.

Reviews.Title: “hotel stay went terribly wrong”
Reviews.Author: GuestAlex
Reviews.Content: check in on the 08/04/2011. after a long flight and trouble finding the Iclub hotel. Step in, no greeting from the staff or whatsoever. They never smile throughout the period. Worst, i was given a room on the 5th level just beside the breakfast lounge! FYI, the breakfast is served at level 5 kind of a room converted into a lounge. Immediately asked the counter staff for change of room but got rejected straight without even trying to help. Worst, the staff said the amount i paid only deserve a room at level 5. For goodness sake, i paid close to US130 and i booked thru the iclub website, it was not given to me free ok!!! As i am a light sleeper, couldnt take it and on the 2nd day requested for assistance for change of room but still got rejected. So everymorning i have got a VERY EFFECTIVE FREE ALARM clock right outside my room as early as 7AM ! (Distance from my room to the lounge?, 01 METRE) Enough said. 1st class room design, 3rd class management staff.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO THERE. DISHONEST MANAGEMENT !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Peterschemberger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively new. Neatly designed. Everything white inside. Unfortunately located at the hooker area of Hong Kong. No lobby, just rooms. I booked a room for 10 nights and made a booking mistake. I intended to go in April but somehow clicked March. Once I arrived they did not only give me no room and kicked me to the street - no they explained me that for reasons of No-Show, they will give me a penalty of the full 10 days ...1.500 € (!!!!!!!!!) for not being in the hotel for not even 1 hour !! This is the most rediciulous behaviour of a hotel I have ever seen. If there is a no show of such kind, a decent hotel would write an email or would call to see what's the problem. They had all information. But they simply kept quiet, cashed the money in and even rented my room out 2 days after no show (this is what the "front desk" lady told me). The management has no integrity and will steal your money. Don't sleep in a hotel where the mafia serves you. Find a decent place. Hong Kong has many honest places. I recommend in the same price level: Langkwai Fong Boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location when attending an exhibition”
Reviews.Author: Michele_Contardi
Reviews.Content: New and modern hotel. Nice room, nice bathroom and confortable bed! Small breakfast. Near the bars in Wan Chai, near the MTR and 15 mins walking to the exhibition center.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, clean room in great location”
Reviews.Author: S_Trinh
Reviews.Content: Great room albeit a bit small. Bathroom / shower cubicle was awesome! Air con was bliss too. 40" TV mounted on the wall with good range of channels. Free WiFi was a great touch. Bed was made everyday and bedding changed twice during our 4 night stay. Very close to Wan Chai MTR (5mins walk) and about 15mins walk to the harbour to catch the ferry to TST & Kowloon. 20mins to Central if you want to go visit the bars in LKF but be warned the drinks aren't cheap in LKFand I live in London! A trip to The Peak is a must. Breakfast really is as monotonous as they say it is. As Hubby and I stayed here for 4 nights I thought I'd try it on our last day... The menu was exactly how other people on here described it! One out of the two lifts would somehow be out of order for a good few hours each day. A bit annoying because you'd have to wait around but at least the other one was working!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, good hotel for value.”
Reviews.Author: RottenKimchi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled here in October. Check in - quick, multilingual staff. Room - small, could fit into my kitchen/living room in my condo (which is not that big). However, this is Hong Kong, it is on Hong Kong Island in fact, and densely populated. A big room is simply not going to happen unless you pay a huge price. Big enough for what we needed, but for someone accostumed to large suites, it will not be what you want. Room was clean. Bed is firm, very firm. Honestly, didn't bother us and we have a pillowtop at home so it was a change. Could hear neighbors if they were loud and especially when in hallway, but not a huge issue. Location - excellent. In Wan Chai a very short walk to the subway. Subway really gets you anywhere you want to go on HK island or in Kowloon and at least the major areas in the New Territories. Also had the trolley stop right by the hotel so gave a quick way to get down to Central. It is in a more residential area when compared to say Central or Admiralty. Great location for walking around. Food - they have an adjacent restaurant that has breakfast included with your room. Its ok. Could go there at night for dinner if you wanted, but with all the good food within blocks, no reason to. We had congee down the block most days for breakfast which was far superior. Good value for money, great location, but just basic amenities. If you want the fancier amenities, go to the Four Seasons, Shangri La, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Needs acoustic improvements”
Reviews.Author: Benji_au
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty new. The rooms are large for Hong Kong, clean, and the interior is modern and stylish. Air conditioning and bedding are fine. However the hotel has a major noise problem which made it difficult to get much sleep. I heard every lift, every arrival and exit of other guests on the tiled floors. The lift areas desperately need carpet on each floor, and the doors need slow-close hinges. If there is a night-time setting on the lifts, it is not active. The place could do with a small gym but if they can fix the noise, then it would be up to the Regal standard..

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mister_euphoria
Reviews.Content: I had chosen this hotel as it has free WiFi and cable broadband, while the room rate is at it's reasonable range. The location was very good. In between Wanchai MTR and Causeway Bay MTR. There's a tram station just a few steps away from the hotel. The hotel's interior was very nice. I got a free upgrade from superior room to a deluxe room with a microwave available as it's amenities. The staffs were very helpful too. They had helped me around the area by using the Tram. If you're going to HKCEC, go towards A5 exit, and walk for about 15mins, you'll reach your destination. The complimentary breakfast is at the cafe right beside the hotel. The cafe itself is quite small, so be sure to catch the breakfast early. The choices are very limited, but good enough to fill up one's stomach. But take note if you're holding trolleys of luggages, the suggested Wanchai MTR exit, A3, doesn't have an escalator going down into the station, only a 'up-going' escalator to the street level. If you require lift access, you can opt for exit A5. From A5 exit, just walk up a bit to the pedestrian crossing, cross the road and walk straight to the hotel. The distance from A3 to hotel or A5 to hotel is about the same. It's just the pedestrian crossings that are available along the streets from different exits.

Reviews.Title: “Average - rooms were ok but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: LuceliaRodrigues
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is generally expensive to stay so this hotel has a reasonable price but you should keep in mind it only offer basic facilities - it feels overpriced if you compare to other cities. The room is small but nicely designed. I had to request that the room was cleaned and things were replaced when finished as they would normally only make the bed. Some staff were nice but I would not rate the service as good which means I will probably not stay there again - serving well does not cost them anything extra.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vasco16
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two nights. We came via MTR and hotel staff was helpful in providing instructions on how to reach from MTR station its just about 5 min walk from Wan Chai station. Lobby was small but staff was very welcoming and pleasant, they even provided us with Travel Adapter which we had forgotten to carry. Currently there is construction going on so the rooms on higher floors are not available due to noise from construction so we were unable to enjoy the view from higher floor. We liked our room with glass interior, it was small but with nice decor. They have free wireless internet access but I had problem accessing it through my android mobile, my girlfriend also had problem initially accessing it from her windows mobile but later on she was able to connect. I was only able to access internet using wifi available in iCafe. They also provide laptop on rent but we found it costly so did not use. Breakfast in the morning was ok. There is also a 24 hours McDonald's right across the road.

Reviews.Title: “modern and cozy”
Reviews.Author: mssuperclean
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a part of the regal chain and because I have had good experiences with them in hong kong, i thought i'd try their new one in the wan chai area. the picture of the room on the website was what attracted me because it was all glass and it included a kitchenette, too. finalizing my reservation with them was very easy including asking for directions from the airport. we took the airport bus and the stop was only about 10 minutes walk to the hotel. the reception is not the usual hotel reception but the concierge was friendly and accommodated us earlier than the check in time. thank god ! we came from a long flight and i needed to, at least, rest. while waiting for our room to be cleaned, we had complimentary breakfast at the i-cafe which is on the same building. thanks for that. our room is not so big but space enough for our suitcases. the light colored walls, glass between the room and the bathroom, white shades, and the cream colored hard floor was great ! i loved the soft, fresh feel of the white comforters, white pillows, and the sheets. if you want privacy in the glass-walled bathroom, you can draw the curtain. some floors of the building are used as offices or senior citizens center so not everybody you see in the elevator are hotel guests. the mini breakfast buffet at the icafe has a selection of cold cuts and jams, and a few cereal choices. enough to start your day walking around hong kong. a supermarket, wellcome is just across the hotel. right in front of the hotel is a tram stop and wan chai subway (mtr) station is about 5-10 min walk. there is a money changer around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “love the room interior”
Reviews.Author: tomjacq
Reviews.Content: was there for 4 nights with my wife. basically we were there for a shopping spree. i booked the room via the hotel. Bernard, the operations manager was really professional. he even called me several times to ensure my stay was pleasant. generally, the rooms was excellent. it's clean, looks very new and everything is in good working order. service was average as complimentary water wasn't topped up everyday unless u ask for it. security is well managed as each key card can only access the lift to the floor that u r staying at. the higher floors are under renovation so I asked for a lower floor room to avoid the construction sound. But anyway we were hardly in the room during the day time and even at the times that we were, I don’t recall hearing any sounds from the renovation work. would i return? definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Not really 4 star”
Reviews.Author: VRBI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights i was very boring with breakfast, every morning is the same style. the laundry service is very poor, even i could not have at the same day of return. the location is good near the station. the room is clean because of new hotel. no bellboy service and no lobby .

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: Cathy0704
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a bit over a week in March. As the hotel is new they have a special deal on so I got a pretty good price. The hotel is new and the rooms are very modern and clean. The hotel is part of a building that houses other offices on some of its floor so the reception area is a bit small and lacks some of the warmth/comfort a hotel might have if the building was devoted entirely to hotel services. The breakfast is served at the restaurant next door which belongs to the hotel and the food lacked a bit of variety. The beds were great with down comforters, the only problem with the room was that the bathroom (shower, toilet) was separated from the sleeping area by a glass, see-through wall which leaves you with absolutely no privacy if you are sharing the room with someone else. Also the sink, although very modern looking, was super tiny and impractical, leaving you with a bunch of water on the floor of the bathroom after washing your face.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, hip little landing pad”
Reviews.Author: cerwin01
Reviews.Content: Quirky place given that Regal has leased a few floors in an office building and converted them into contemporary hotel rooms. On the elevator ride, you are almost certain to stop at Floors 1 or 2 for a pick up/drop off of charming senior citizens from the Methodist Senior Center. Location is fantastically in the center of the Wan Chai street scene and easy 5-10 min walking distance from the Star Ferry terminal and MRT. As stated in other reviews, breakfast is an overstatement. Coffee/tea and toast or croissant. I found the staff to be kind and professional though I already know the area so I didn't require assistance beyond check-in/check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there for 5 nights. Location is...”
Reviews.Author: mingzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights. Location is very convenient. Though it's not as extreme as 3 min walk to the MTR subway station. It's only about a 5-7min normal pace walk. Great for me as I was working at the HKCEC convention center and I just had to take a 15min stroll daily to work. Perfect as I don't need to squeeze with the morning crowds on public transport. There are many convenient shops and eateries along the street so you don't have to worry about getting a meal or snack. The rooms are Cosy (on the small side) but just enough for one person in the iselect room. I loved that they had free wifi LAN included. Great for the business traveller. Nice flat screen tv infront of the bed. Love to lie & watch MTV. All this great stuff said, the service is average. It's not a full fledged hotel. Don't expect service staff to be at your beck & call constantly. Also the floors are not carpeted but tiled and doors a little thin so you can actually hear people in the hall way. Especially if they are wearing high heels, rolling their luggage along or having a loud conversation. Guess if you're someone who needs absolute peace & quiet this isn't for you. And I realize this building isn't a full hotel. Some floors are offices & there's even an elderly day care centre below. So be prepared to be rushing with old folks and office workers for the lift. While there's breakfast included in the hotel rate, they mght as well remove it and give a discount to the hotel rates. There's nothing on the menu except toast croissant jam honey hard boiled eggs packaged cornflakes some measly ham slices yoghurt packets milk juice and canned fruit pieces. Everyday. Imagine having this for 6 days!! No change no variety. All that said, I would still select this hotel for my next business trip for the good location. But I'd ask them if the could cut out the breakfast from my rate. There's better food along the street that hardly costs hkd68.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: pppman
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 3 nights. We normally stay in 4 to 5 star hotels around the world & this was definitely about 4 star standard as stated on the websites. I had reserved 2 twin beds but when we checked in all they had was a room with a Queen size bed which was very small. I complained but all the twins had been allocated. We managed to get a twin for the next 2 nights. The twin room is much larger and roomier than the room with a queen size bed. We had breakfast included in the rate (about US$80 / night). This was OK - cereals, toast, boiled eggs, hams, danish pastries etc. Excellent location amongst the shops & the underground station. Reception staff were quite unhelpful. Overall, we were very happy with it. It was clean and what we expected. The photos on the website matched the room. My wife was concerned about the clear glass bathroom - but there is a curtain you can pull around the glass.

Reviews.Title: “services need to be improved”
Reviews.Author: lesportsacfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom with living room suite for 2 weeks. Our relative booked it for us for the location. The suite was spacious and modern but not too user friendly. All the staffs were not welcoming nor show any interest to help the guests. It seems like they were all prohibited to smile or say "good morning" to greet the guests. The included continental breakfast was very lousy that we would rather ditch it for Mcdonald. The hotel only has 9-10 floors in a building mixed with offices and senior activity center. Even though the hotels itself is non-smoking but you can smell smoke from other areas inside the room sometimes. Bring your laptop if you need to access wifi. The monitor inside the room is for "decoration". My relative was told the airport transfer was complimentary at booking, but when we asked about it at checking out, they said it would cost $110HK each. This is certainly not my choice hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Service attitude dreadful”
Reviews.Author: TomasScotland
Reviews.Content: Generally an interesting if functional hotel, over-priced for the services and amenities available. Rooms are a matter of taste - I like the while and glass design but its certainly not to everyone's taste. In room amenities are quite good - free wifi, microwave, safe etc. cafe is very poor and "free" continentail breakfast lacks imagination - no fresh fruit, for example. But the location os good and the vegan/ vegetarian restaurant next door is fab. The real issue is one of service. All the staff (with the honourable exception of housekeeping) are beautiful people who totally lack personality and interest in their customers - its like interacting with an automated check-in machine. Never a smile, never a modicum of interest in what you are asking about - just a barked response to questions. Regal have a real problem here that they need to address. As a result, I will never stay here again (and I come to HK frequently) or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Comfortable and Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: FlozZil
Reviews.Content: My uni friend and I had stayed in Regal iClub Hotel for few nights recently. The design of the hotel room is modern and cozy. The lunch buffet that we had in iCafe is worth what we paid. The hotel location and the internet being included in the room rate are the two things which we enjoyed the most when we stay in there. The hotel is so close to the Wan Chai train station and other entertainments. My friend and I felt safe and comfortable in traveling around different places by ourself. Without the easy access with the public transport, my friend and I would found so much trouble in getting back to hotel after shopping and sightseeing in Hong Kong, especially during the night. As I have mentioned before, the rate included internet is the other thing that I like. I could catch up with friends and family without worry in paying extra fees for internet. I had a good experience in Regal iClub Hotel. In my opinion, the price is reasonable and it is worth what I've paid.

Reviews.Title: “Quality at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: hybrid_a
Reviews.Content: As a young inexperienced traveler, I always do a great amount of research before settling for a place to stay. Regal Hotel met my expectations; a comfortable and contemporary design; excellent service and quality of leisure for a reasonable price; internet convenience without extra fees. A quality stay overall for my exploration of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: WopWops
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute through Expedia. No reviews so we were a little nervous, however, went on the good Regal name and we weren't disappointed. Realised after that Wan Chai is known as a 'red light' district. On checking in, we were upgraded to a suite which was an amazing two rooms. Lots of glass and mirrors, (you can see through to the shower and toilet from the bedroom) and very clean and spacious for Hong Kong. Staff on recepetion very friendly and helpful when we needed a shaving kit and more tissues - nothing seemed to be a problem. Our only criticism for the room was that it seemed to be set for one person, i.e. only one coffee sachet, one soap etc. I am sure that if we asked for more, we would have got some. Views not that great. We were on the 15th floor and looked out to other dull and run down buildings. If we wanted a view we would have stayed elsewhere and paid more. Wan Chai has a rather large local market which was fun to explore. Lots of buses and trams available to catch and hotel is only 5 minutes walk from Wan Chai station. We felt safe and comfortable exploring the area by night and no evidence of 'red light' activity. We struggled to find a bar to have a drink, but we did set out late and if we had ventured more towards central then we wouldn't have had a problem. Continental breakfast was served in the Cafe downstairs and very good with pastries, toast, fruit, yoghurts and good coffee. The Regal iCity was a great find for us and we wouldn't hesitate staying again. We think we got a fantastic deal because the hotel is still being renovated and is realtively new on the scene. Thanks for the upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely do not stay in this noisy, badly designed over rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: smart_traveller_10
Reviews.Content: Well I travel alot, and pride myself on being a sophisticated traveller. This latest creation from Regal Hotels in the heart of Wanchai is an abomination. Its noisy. Just like a hospital. You cant sleep as the walls and flooring all seem to be tiled... All night long you hear footsteps, banging, and echoing from the floors above. The rooms are overlit with flourescent style lighting. And even when you turn the lights off, you cant get complete darkness because the TV monitor light is so bright. You have to drape a towel over it.... And beware of cheap deals its because they have workmen working through the night... Its just like being in a noisy hospital. Dont stay there if you want to sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Regal iClub Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.211 Johnston Road, Wan Chai, Hong Kong, China
